newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ dlr strength a concern of all parties - Peters.
newsitem.headline: NZ dlr strength a concern of all parties - Peters.

text.p: New Zealand First Party leader Winston Peters said on Thursday that the strength of the New Zealand dollar was as concerning to other parties as it was to NZ First.
"It's a matter that's exercising the minds of all political parties here, us no less than others," he told a news conference.
Peters reiterated comments that those responsible for the strength of the New Zealand dollar, which hit a new 8-1/2 year high today, were in the current caretaker government regime.
Peters said that NZ First, which holds the balance of power following the inconclusive October 12 election, campaigned on the basis of an export-led recovery.
He said he was still of the view that there would be an export-led recovery, but people would have to wait until a coalition was formed to find out how that would come about.
"In the meantime I can't say anything positive or meaningful because we're in opposition effectively," Peters said.
